summary: I remember when I walked out of the theater after watching The Avengers for the first time thinking “... I’m kind of like really...
body:
I remember when I walked out of the theater after watching The Avengers for the first time thinking “… I’m kind of like really in love with Loki???!!!” Like, I was so perplexed. I seriously wanted the bad guy?! Even with the likes of RDJ and Chris Hemsworth on screen all I could focus on was the bad guy?! Whaaa?! I quickly went online and found y’all and was so happy! Watched Thor 1 and I was hooked. Head over heels. My love for him has only grown since then.

Tell me your Loki story! I love to hear them! Lets reminisce on the day we became part of his loyal army💚

summary: Wearing His Clothes (a Bucky x female reader fanfic)
title: Wearing His Clothes (a Bucky x female reader fanfic)
body:
Fandom: Marvel

Genre: Porny fluff. Fluffy porn? A bit of angst underneath.

Rating: R. NC-17? There’s smut. Beware.

Summary: Bucky likes it when you wear his hoodies. Like…really likes it.

Warnings/Notes: Trying out a different way of inserting the reader into the story. I like romanticizing every stupid thing I do thinking about what other people think about me, so…this is Bucky’s POV and he’s just wildly in love with the female reader. I hope that’s not a problem.



Wearing His Clothes

Solo missions always did this to him.


By the time he got back to the Tower, he was hardly human anymore. His throat was ragged, and there was that distinct metallic, coppery taste in his mouth that he hated. His neck and shoulders were sore, the kinds of aches that threatened to become part of his body. He leaned against the side wall of the elevator and jabbed blindly at the button for his floor. He could feel the blood on his hands. He’d cleaned up on the jet, of course, but…the blood was still there. He could feel it burning into his skin. It’d never not be there. He finally gave in to his body’s primary demand: he let his eyelids droop closed, in some feeble attempt to shut out the broken, teeming world that he had to see every day.


He didn’t even really open his eyes when the elevator stopped and the doors slid open; he just readjusted his bag on his shoulder and took a step out. Some time to himself, that’d be good. Some time to exist in his own space, in his own past.

Wearing His Clothes

Solo missions always did this to him.


By the time he got back to the Tower, he was hardly human anymore. His throat was ragged, and there was that distinct metallic, coppery taste in his mouth that he hated. His neck and shoulders were sore, the kinds of aches that threatened to become part of his body. He leaned against the side wall of the elevator and jabbed blindly at the button for his floor. He could feel the blood on his hands. He’d cleaned up on the jet, of course, but…the blood was still there. He could feel it burning into his skin. It’d never not be there. He finally gave in to his body’s primary demand: he let his eyelids droop closed, in some feeble attempt to shut out the broken, teeming world that he had to see every day.


He didn’t even really open his eyes when the elevator stopped and the doors slid open; he just readjusted his bag on his shoulder and took a step out. Some time to himself, that’d be good. Some time to exist in his own space, in his own past.
